headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; NEW MARKET. NEBRASKA. CITY MORTALITY. FOUND DROWNED. CITY COURT--CRIMINAL TERM.

docs.lead_paragraph: NEW MARKET.--A new market-house is being erected at the corner of Hamilton-avenue and Van Brunt-street, of the same dimensions as the Atlantic-street market. NEBRASKA.--An anti-Nebraska meeting will be held in this city next week. TALITY.-The Health Officer reports

headline.main: FROM CALIFORNIA.; Arrival of the Star of the West. ERRIBLE CALAMITY. A Boat Filled with Passengers Swamped. GREAT LOSS OF LIFE. Indignation MIeeting on Board the Star of the West.of the West.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Star of the West, Captain E. L. TINKLEPAUGH, eight days from San Juan, with 110 passengers and $913,611 in gold on freight, to CHARLES MORGAN. headline.main: TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA.; ARRIVAL OF THE NORTH STAR. BETTER MINING NEWS. Overstocked Market. BAD CONDITION OF TRADE. LOSS OF PACKET-SHIP SAN FRANCISCO. POLITICAL EXCITEMENT. THE DEFAULT IN STATE INTEREST. Later from Lower California. WALKER'S EXPEDITION. DESERTION OF PART OF HIS FORCE. LATER FROM OREGON, WASHINGTON TERRITORY. THE SANDWICH ISLANDS. LATER FROM THE ISTHMUS. DARIEN CANAL EXPEDITION. LIEUT. STRAIN NOT HEARD FROM.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship North Star, of VANDERBILT'S Independent Line, arrived at this port on Saturday, from Aspinwall, with 300 passengers, bringing California news to the 16th February, two weeks later than the previous packet. The North Star brought no gold on freight. We are indebted to the Puiser, and also to the different Express Companies, for files of San Francisco and Panama papers.
docs.abstract: Abandoned by a majority of his troops

headline.main: MEDICAL MATTERS.; College of Physicians and Surgeons. DR. STEVENS' ADDRESS. DUTIES OF A PHYSICIAN EXPLAINED.

docs.lead_paragraph: The commencement of the Now-York College of Physicians and Surgeons took place Thurs 'day night, at the College, in Crosby-st. There was a crowded auditory,' comprising physicians, medical students and ladies. headline.main: OPENING OF ALBANY-STREET.; Argument of Mr. P. Y. Cutler before the Committee.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Detention and Abandoument of the Black Warrior. Final Release of the American Sailors. Arrival of the Corwin--Surrender of the Black Warrior. Letter from the Agents of the Steamer.

docs.lead_paragraph: After closing my correspondence for the Black Warrier last evening, the community were surprised with the information that she would be detained by the Government. To-day we find that she hase been abandoned by Capt. BULLOCK, and is left upon the hand of his irresponsible Government, with which our troubles, according to present appearances, are never to have an end. It

byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

headline.main: Religious Character of the Chinese Rebellion; Letter from Dr. Medhurst.t.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the North China Herald: DEAR SIR : As everything regarding the insurgents possesses a degree of interest at the present moment, I beg leave to send you the following account: Having obtained admission into the city of Shanghai this afternoon, I proceeded to one of the Chapels belonging to the London Missionary Society, where I commenced preaching to a large congregation, which had almost immediately gathered within the walls.
docs.abstract: Dr. Medhurst on the religion of the rebels

docs.lead_paragraph: The friends of Anatomical Science can rejoice in one triumph at least. The Dissection bill has not, indeed, passed the Assembly, but it has been repeatedly discussed there, and members have learned to face the ghost without childish shivering.
docs.snippet: The friends of Anatomical Science can rejoice in one triumph at least. The Dissection bill has not, indeed, passed the Assembly, but it has been repeatedly discussed there, and members have learned to face the ghost without childish shivering.

docs.lead_paragraph: Very summary action was taken last evening in regard to the streets of the City. The two Boards, in separate session, and afterwards in joint meeting as the Sanatory Committee of the Board of Health, pushed through promptly such measures as they deemed essential to the preservation of the public health.

docs.lead_paragraph: It would seem as if some men considered it a sin ever to sell a pure article, if it be possible to adulterate it with something cheaper.
